data.text: @NoahTzedek There is no alt text for this image, I'm sorry.
@wherewereweb4 The 27% is for testing positive. Adding quarantine and covid-related closures brings it up to 60%!
@wsbgnl And add asymptomatic to that and we have even a lot more people going to work positive. And now since it's a cold (sarcasm) will be even less testing, more going to work sick.

@wsbgnl Yes but mostly due to quarantine. Containing a contagious disease means removing several workers for each infected worker. That gets costly! Much cheaper and easier to simply let disease spread. Saying it is nice and mild before the spreading helps people feel good cheer about it
Nearly half of lower income households report difficultly paying for expenses in the past three months https://t.co/4iZRUrDtxS
Lower wage workers are much more likely to report going to work despite covid infection or exposure https://t.co/fK764v0kUB
Lower wage workers are much less likely to receive paid time off for covid infection or quarantine https://t.co/1OxhTiSVzI
